intro: Chamaenerion danielsii, commonly known as Daniel's fireweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It has slender, erect stems and lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
